# About Logic20/20

Logic20/20 is a business and technology consulting firm founded in 2005 by Christian O’Meara. The company is headquartered in Seattle, Washington, USA [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/logic20-20). Logic20/20 specializes in enhancing client performance through strategy, technology, and data, offering services such as advanced analytics, digital transformation, and strategy & operations [(Logic20/20, Company Overview)](https://logic2020.com/).

The company serves a diverse range of industries, including energy and utilities, technology and communications, financial services, healthcare, and education. It operates primarily in a B2B model, working with clients ranging from startups to Fortune 100 companies, as well as state and local government organizations [(Logic20/20, About Logic20/20)](https://www.logic2020.com/careers/life-at-logic).

Logic20/20 has been recognized for its workplace culture, being named a "Best Company to Work For" multiple times and achieving certification from Great Place To Work based on positive employee feedback [(Great Place To Work, Working at Logic20/20)](https://www.greatplacetowork.com/certified-company/7054203). The company emphasizes a collaborative culture, continuous learning, and core values of excellence, integrity, and teamwork [(Logic20/20, Company Overview)](https://logic2020.com/).

The firm has also been recognized for its growth, being listed as one of Inc. Magazine's fastest-growing firms [(Logic20/20, About Logic20/20)](https://www.logic2020.com/careers/life-at-logic). Logic20/20's revenue and specific financial details are not publicly disclosed, but its recognition for growth suggests a strong market position.

# Key Personnel

- **Christian O’Meara**: Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer, focused on strategic business development and fostering a positive workplace culture [(Logic20/20, Company Overview)](https://logic2020.com/).
- **Travis Jones**: Chief Operating Officer, responsible for growth initiatives and client enablement, with extensive international consulting experience [(Logic20/20, Company Overview)](https://logic2020.com/).
- **Julie Meredith**: Chief Financial Officer, overseeing finance and accounting operations, with a strong background in financial strategy [(LinkedIn, 2024-03-14)](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/logic20-20-inc-_we-are-excited-to-welcome-julie-meredith-activity-7173713087768776704-vjvZ).
- **Will Schmidt**: General Manager, Head of Consulting, leading the consulting practice and ensuring client satisfaction [(Logic20/20, Company Overview)](https://logic2020.com/).
- **Nick Maddock**: Managing Director, Strategy & Operations, focusing on consulting innovation and project delivery excellence [(Logic20/20, Company Overview)](https://logic2020.com/).

# News

## Workplace Recognition

Logic20/20 has consistently been recognized as a top workplace, earning its ninth consecutive recognition as a Washington Best Company to Work For [(Mike Cohen, 2025-01-13)](https://www.einpresswire.com/article/775277100/logic20-20-earns-ninth-consecutive-recognition-as-a-washington-best-company-to-work-for). This recognition highlights the company's commitment to fostering a positive and collaborative work environment.

## Product and Service Innovations

### Renewable Energy Forecasting

Logic20/20 has developed AI and ML-powered forecasting solutions to improve the accuracy of renewable energy forecasts, helping utilities maintain a stable energy supply and meet carbon-free electricity goals [(Lago, Logic20/20, 2024-02-20)](https://logic2020.com/insight/renewable-energy-forecasting-with-ai-and-machine-learning/).

### AI in Customer Service

The company is innovating in customer service by implementing AI tools that enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of customer service operations, transforming call centers into revenue-generating assets [(Parker, Lee, Logic20/20, 2024-05-10)](https://logic2020.com/insight/ai-call-center-generates-revenue/).

## Partnerships

Logic20/20 has partnered with Optelos to deliver AI analysis for drone inspections in the utility sector, combining technical expertise with visual data management capabilities to automate inspection programs [(Bauman, Optelos, 2021-02-09)](https://optelos.com/news/).

## Thought Leadership

The company has released a white paper on the transformative power of asset image analytics, showcasing its commitment to thought leadership and innovation in the consulting industry [(Mike Cohen, 2024-09-30)](https://www.einpresswire.com/article/747187660/logic20-20-releases-white-paper-on-the-transformative-power-of-asset-image-analytics).

# Conclusion

Logic20/20 is a dynamic consulting firm leveraging advanced technologies to address contemporary business challenges. With a strong focus on employee satisfaction, innovative product offerings, and strategic partnerships, the company is well-positioned for continued growth and success in the consulting industry.

# Logic20/20 Company Overview

## Company History
Logic20/20 was founded in 2005 by Christian O’Meara with a vision of creating a collaborative environment where like-minded individuals could achieve great things. The firm has since grown into a high-value business and technology consulting company, focusing on elevating client performance through strategy, technology, and data.

## Leadership Team
- **Christian O’Meara** - Chief Executive Officer and co-founder, focused on strategic business development and creating a positive workplace culture.
- **Travis Jones** - Chief Operating Officer, responsible for growth initiatives and client enablement, with extensive international consulting experience.
- **Julie Meredith** - Chief Financial Officer, overseeing finance and accounting operations, with a strong background in financial strategy.
- **Will Schmidt** - General Manager, Head of Consulting, leading the consulting practice and ensuring client satisfaction.
- **Nick Maddock** - Managing Director, Strategy & Operations, focusing on consulting innovation and project delivery excellence.

## Services
Logic20/20 offers a range of consulting services across various domains:

- **Advanced Analytics**: Tailored analytics solutions including data science, predictive analytics, and data integration.
  
- **Digital Transformation**: Enhancing communication and customer experience through technology, including UX/UI design and cloud strategy.
  
- **Strategy & Operations**: Supporting core initiatives with a focus on business strategy, process design, and change management.

## Products
The firm provides customized solutions that leverage technology to solve complex business problems. Their offerings include:

- Data Science & Predictive Analytics
- AI & Machine Learning
- Visual Analytics
- Digital & Cloud Strategy
- Technical Project/Product Management

## Customers
Logic20/20 serves a diverse clientele across multiple industries, including:

- **Energy & Utilities**: Helping utility providers optimize operations.
- **Technology & Communications**: Supporting tech and telecom businesses in gaining competitive advantages.
- **Financial Services**: Assisting financial institutions in navigating industry changes.
- **Healthcare**: Partnering with healthcare providers to enhance service delivery.
- **Education**: Empowering educational institutions to improve student outcomes.

## Culture
Logic20/20 fosters a collaborative and inclusive culture, emphasizing:

- **One Team Philosophy**: Promoting unity and transparency in client relationships and internal operations.
- **Continuous Learning**: Encouraging professional growth through mentorship and career management programs.
- **Core Values**: Driven by excellence, integrity, and a culture of collaboration.

## Insights and Thought Leadership
The company shares expert insights on various topics, including:

- Data strategy and responsible AI
- Digital transformation trends
- The integration of drones and AI in utilities

## Partnerships
Logic20/20 has established long-term partnerships with leading technology providers, including Microsoft, to enhance their service offerings and deliver tailored solutions to clients.

## Conclusion
Logic20/20 is committed to delivering high-impact solutions that drive business success while fostering a culture of growth, collaboration, and integrity. Their diverse expertise and client-centric approach position them as a leader in the consulting industry.

For more information, visit their website: [Logic20/20](https://logic2020.com/)

# [Privacy Policy on 2023-09-05](https://logic2020.com/privacy-policy/)
Logic20/20 Inc (“Logic20/20”) respects your privacy and is sensitive to concerns regarding the collection and use of personal data. Our goal is to provide you with information targeted to your industry, your role in your organization, and your specific preferences. In order to provide you with information that is relevant to your needs, and to fulfill specific requests on your part, we may occasionally request personal information from you.

The information requested, and how it is used will vary depending on the information you requested.

Logic20/20 has developed this Privacy Policy to explain why we collect particular information and the measures we will use to protect your personal privacy within our website (the “Site”). The following information summarizes Logic20/20’s policy relating to the collection and use of information obtained from the Site. By using this Site, you consent to the collection and use of information about you in the ways described in this Privacy Policy. Logic20/20 reserves the right to change its Privacy Policy at any time by posting the new privacy statement on our website. By using the Site subsequent to such changes, you consent to them.

COLLECTION AND USE OF PERSONAL INFORMATION

Logic20/20 will only collect contact and other personally identifying information, such as your name, address, phone number, and e-mail address (“Personal Information”), when voluntarily submitted by you, such as when you contact us or complete an online form or request. If you do not want us to collect any Personal Information, do not submit it to us.

Your Personal Information may be stored and used by Logic20/20 to provide services to you (including services provided by third parties with whom we may need to share your personal information), to create a personalized experience for you, and to get in touch with you when necessary with respect to information exchanged through the Site, material changes in our Site’s policies, new products or services that Logic20/20 may offer, or otherwise.

If you do not wish to receive such materials, you may opt-out (See the Opt-Out/Corrections section below for more information.)

Except as described in this Privacy Policy, we will not sell, rent or disclose your Personal Information to our business partners, suppliers, vendors or other third parties without notifying you of our intent to share the information and giving you an opportunity to prevent your information from being shared. Logic20/20 reserves the right to disclose your Personal Information to its successors-in-interest or in connection with a merger or acquisition transaction or change of control or when required by law or necessary to protect the rights, property, or personal safety of Logic20/20, its customers and/or the public.

COLLECTION AND USE OF NON-PERSONAL INFORMATION

Demographic and profile data (e.g. job title, corporate function) may be collected at our Site. In addition, when you access the Site, our Web server may automatically collect certain information that is not personally identifiable, such as your IP address, pages viewed, length of time spent on the Site and other transactions performed on the Site. We store and use the foregoing information, in the aggregate only, to diagnose problems with our server, to improve and track the success of the Site, to provide content of interest to you, and for other similar purposes. We may share the foregoing information with advertisers or other third parties, including our business partners, suppliers, and vendors, on an aggregated basis without revealing any personally identifiable information.

USE OF COOKIES

Our Site may use cookies to enhance your experience while using our Site. Cookies are small electronic files that a website may transfer to the user’s computer, and are used for record-keeping purposes. Use of cookies makes web-surfing easier for you by performing certain functions such as saving your passwords or your personal preferences regarding your use of a particular website. Many consider the use of cookies to be an industry standard.

Your browser is probably set to accept cookies. However, if you would prefer not to receive cookies, you can alter the configuration of your browser to refuse cookies. If you choose to have your browser refuse cookies, it is possible that some areas of our Site will not function properly when you view them.

EXTERNAL OR THIRD-PARTY WEBSITES

To the extent hyperlinks are utilized to access external or third-party sites, you should be aware that these external or third-party sites are not controlled by Logic20/20 and, therefore, are not subject to this Privacy Policy. Logic20/20 suggests that you check the privacy policies of these sites to determine how your personal information will be utilized by the proprietors of those third-party sites.

INFORMATION SECURITY

This Site has commercially reasonable security measures in place to protect against the loss, misuse and alteration of the information under Logic20/20’s control. All sensitive customer information collected by Logic20/20 through the Site will be protected by commercially reasonable means. All information, once received, is stored behind our corporate firewall. Note, however, that although Logic20/20 has endeavored to create a secure and reliable Site, the confidentiality of any communication or material transmitted via the Internet or stored on our servers cannot be completely guaranteed. Accordingly, you should consider carefully if you want to submit sensitive information via the Internet.

OPT-OUT/CORRECTIONS

If, at any time, you wish to stop receiving e-mail information from Logic20/20, you may unsubscribe by replying to the e-mail with the words “unsubscribe” in the subject line or by unsubscribing through the link at the bottom of the email. If you want to update, correct, or delete your Personal Information, you may email us at the address listed below with any requests or changes. In the event Logic20/20 receives such a request or change, Logic20/20 may require you to confirm or verify any change to your record. Also, please be aware that it may take a few days to process your request.

CONTACT

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, the practices of this Site, or your dealings with this Site, you can contact us at:

Logic20/20 Inc.

1501 1st Ave South, Suite 310

Seattle, WA 98134

(206) 576-0400

# [Leadership on 2023-08-23](https://logic2020.com/company/leadership/)
Christian O’Meara

Chief Executive Officer

Christian O’Meara is Chief Executive Officer and co-founder of Logic20/20, which he started in 2005 with a belief that a group of like-minded people, doing work that they love, can accomplish great things. Much of his time is spent managing strategic business-development initiatives and recruiting key personnel according to that philosophy. Christian’s business strategy is based on creating simplicity in complex environments, developing a personalized approach for every client and every consultant, and creating a great place for employees to work.

Prior to starting Logic20/20 and moving to Seattle, Christian was a top performer in enterprise software sales for Quest Software and Cabletron Systems, covering the United Kingdom and Ireland. His time spent in Uganda doing relief work led to his ongoing involvement as board member and sponsor of Leaders for Africa, an organization that provides educational opportunities to students from developing African nations.

Christian has a Bachelor of Arts degree from Brunel University, London, an institution known for combining academic rigor with practical, entrepreneurial, and imaginative approaches to solving business problems.

While Christian is the CEO of Logic20/20, his first job is Dad: he is an active volunteer at his children’s school and as a soccer coach. Christian is very involved with the Seattle sports community, both as a rugby player with the Northwest Old Boys, coach and co-founder of the West Seattle Wildcats Youth Rugby Club, and as a board member of Crossfires Premiere Soccer Club.

Travis Jones

Chief Operating Officer

Chief Operating Officer Travis Jones leads Logic20/20’s growth initiatives and enterprise client enablement. His brings to the role a proven track record of delivering measurable business value and applying technology solutions to solve business challenges. Travis is passionate about spending time with his teams and empowering them to enhance the value they deliver to clients while also supporting their professional growth.

Having consulted and lived in Australia, Europe, and the United States, Travis brings extensive experience that spans three continents in both IT and management. His depth of experience has made him a trusted partner to colleagues and clients, alike. Travis comes from a “big 4” background and was an experienced manager with Accenture, working in a variety of practice areas: Communications and High Technology; Energy; Health and Life Sciences; and Retail. He’s taken his big 4 training and applied it at Logic20/20, growing numerous parts of the business during his tenure.

Travis holds two bachelor’s degrees from the University of Melbourne, Australia: one in civil engineering, and one in commerce with a specialization in finance and marketing. He also spent a year as an exchange student at the University of California, San Diego, learning American culture and enjoying the California lifestyle.

Travis’ life at home is punctuated by the rare Seattle opportunity for outdoor entertaining, which allows him to share his grill-tending approach with friends and family. He also enjoys indulging in some quiet time reading a novel or swimming and enjoying the PNW with his wife and two boys.

Julie Meredith

Chief Financial Officer

Chief Financial Officer Julie Meredith is responsible for developing and overseeing Logic20/20’s finance and accounting operations. With her extensive financial and operational expertise and strategic vision, Julie is ideally suited to her mission of driving the firm’s financial growth and elevating its client services.

Julie has a proven history of driving financial success in diverse and dynamic environments, previously serving as the Chief Financial Officer for the Global Good Fund at Intellectual Ventures. During her tenure, she played a pivotal role in presenting financial strategies to key stakeholders while managing a multi-million-dollar budget.

She has consistently demonstrated her ability to streamline processes, optimize financial performance, and foster growth opportunities. Throughout her career, she has led numerous high-performing teams, implemented cutting-edge financial systems, and navigated complex financial landscapes with finesse and acumen.

Julie holds a Bachelor of Arts in accounting from Pacific University and an MBA from Seattle University.

Will Schmidt

General Manager, Head of Consulting

Will Schmidt, General Manager for the Consulting Practice, is responsible for leading the practice to exceed client expectations, develop innovative solutions, and achieve organizational growth. The Logic20/20 Consulting Practice comprises Cloud, System Integration, Custom Development, Business Intelligence, and Leadership service offerings. Will has over 20 years of consulting experience—leading the development of complex national and international technology solutions for government agencies, and providing technology management subject matter expertise and assessment services to the nonprofit and financial services sectors. He strives to provide effective, leading-edge solutions to Logic20/20 by using proven management methodologies.

Will holds a Bachelor of Science from Susquehanna University and has a PMP certification. He moved to Seattle from Washington, D.C., to explore the Pacific Northwest and serve a new set of clients.

Nick Maddock

Managing Director, Strategy & Operations

Nick Maddock, Managing Director of Strategy & Operations, is responsible for consulting innovation and the close partnership between consulting and sales. With a passion for delivery excellence garnered over 20 years working as an executive management consultant and senior manager, Nick has extensive leadership experience in delivering demanding projects and developing new products across IT, strategy, marketing, and operations. He has a proven ability to manage business change and develop new business ideas, make sense of complex data, organize resources, and liaise with colleagues at all levels to get the best out of every situation.

Nick graduated from the University of Edinburgh with an MBA and a BEng in Manufacturing Systems Engineering. He has worked extensively across the United Kingdom, Europe, and the United States, to which he moved five years ago.

In his free time, Nick is an avid soccer fan, keen tennis player, and poor skier, and he enjoys most things outdoors—an obsession that he (mostly) shares with his three children.

# [Who We Are on 2023-09-05](https://logic2020.com/company/our-values/)
“I know I can trust the culture and integrity of what my company stands for. I walk into work every day with a smile knowing I get to come back to a place where I feel respected and valued as an employee.”

The origin of our company values

To decide our values, we began by creating a small internal committee of diverse people from across our organization. This committee surveyed all our employees to understand the values that were most important to them in three categories: personal, internal (within our company), and external (to our clients). These included words like curiosity, integrity, improvement, dedication, and harmony, to name a few.

We then collated the responses and categorized them by general themes. With the themes pinpointed, we brought them together to form our three values. Both our leadership and consultants quickly championed these values in internal meetings and client relationships—and the rest is history.

“Our Culture of We empowers me to make decisions that better the company, to spend time getting to know everyone at Logic20/20 on a first name basis, and to invest my time and resources in others.”

# Logic20/20, founded 2005-01-01 [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/logic20-20)
Logic20/20 is a consulting firm with an intersection of business and technology to simplify complex projects. It also focuses on helping their customers predict and increase sales and understand their customers, tasks, automates repetitive, and increase the innovation to market.

Logic20/20 in 2016, 2017, and 2018 was named WA 100 Best Companies to Work For and 2018 Consulting Magazine Fastest Growing Organization.

Logic20/20 was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Seattle, Washingon, USA.

- [Website](https://www.logic2020.com)
- [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/logic20-20-inc-)
- [Twitter](https://www.twitter.com/logic2020)

## News

- Logic20/20 earns ninth consecutive recognition as a Washington Best Company to Work For ([Mike Cohen, 2025-01-13](https://www.einpresswire.com/article/775277100/logic20-20-earns-ninth-consecutive-recognition-as-a-washington-best-company-to-work-for))
- Logic20/20 releases white paper on the transformative power of asset image analytics ([Mike Cohen, 2024-09-30](https://www.einpresswire.com/article/747187660/logic20-20-releases-white-paper-on-the-transformative-power-of-asset-image-analytics))
- Logic20/20, Inc. on LinkedIn: We are excited to welcome Julie Meredith as Logic20/20's new Chief… ([LinkedIn, 2024-03-14](https://www.linkedin.com/posts/logic20-20-inc-_we-are-excited-to-welcome-julie-meredith-activity-7173713087768776704-vjvZ))
- Consistency, Trust and Respect: How Logic20/20 Defines Company Culture ([Avery Komlofske, 2023-01-18](https://www.builtinseattle.com/2023/01/18/consistency-trust-and-respect-logic2020-company-culture))

reviews.cons: None as of yet at this time
reviews.pros: Everyone is so helpful. The training opportunities are abundant. I feel very supported.

reviews.cons:
long term growth
inconsistent 
lack of meaningful work
reviews.pros:
remote opportunities
work/life balance
co-workers/Managers

reviews.advice: Create an environment that is not sales centric and that promotes upward feedback
reviews.cons:
-furloughs and layoffs done frequently
-leadership has petty disagreements that make it hard to navigate
-lots of talk about growing pains at small company but seems to be more of an excuse for messy implementations
-rather than investing in junior to mid level employee the company is heavy at the leadership level
reviews.pros: The people are truly delightful and kind
reviews.summary: Has potential but squandered by leadership

reviews.cons: Remote employees/culture needs more engagement.
reviews.pros: Great leadership and culture. ELT is very transparent, accessible, and involved. Team genuinely cares about others and works well together. Solutions delivered are cutting edge and very impactful.

reviews.advice: It feels like our CEO is a distant observer. A suggestion could be for him to read out candidly comments from our annual employee surveys, if he sees them, to address some of our concerns and questions. When leaders yell at us in public space, it does not feel like we are putting the same amount of effort into our company values as they are. Can you please reflect on if our senior leaders are held accountable for being an example to the rest of us?
reviews.cons: A lot of employees leave after a short stay and the company has also cut a lot recently. VERY high cost per month for benefits. 1% 401k match of your yearly salary seems low for tech. Leadership loses their tempers and has yelled at co-workers in front of us. ~Every~ employee is required to make outreach to our Linkedin network to attempt to find new work for the business and asked to record your attempts for verification. Working 40 hour weeks is considered doing the minimum, so you will need to consistently bill more than 40 hours to be graded well in your reviews.
reviews.pros: Our social committee sends out fun things to do virtually. You can receive reimbursement for training opportunities, but know you may need to pay them back if you don't stay with the company long enough. There's a good effort to make consultants feel connected across remote HUBs. Clients to work with are high-profile. Smart people to work alongside with that have good industry experience to learn from. The employees that have a long tenure can start to receive more benefits.
reviews.summary: Make sure you do your due diligence on the culture

reviews.cons: Can be chaotic. Strong personalities.
reviews.pros: Small company feel, access to C-Suite, fast-paced
reviews.summary: Opportunities abound - but expect to work

reviews.advice: CEO is absent. He needs to read survey results and digest what worker bees are saying. CEO needs to hold C Suite accountable for poor leadership. Allow fully remote and you'll include a lot more great minds. Follow the values.
reviews.cons: Leadership is poor. There are 4 C Suite people that bicker and fight amongst themselves. They and other leaders are good in practice, but bad at leading people. They shout from the rooftops at what employees should/shouldn't do and then complain whenever a task takes longer than reasonable. Attrition rate is HIGH because of one leader especially. Good people don't stick around. For a tech org, Logic20/20 operates like the 1990s. Old ways, old tech, old platform. Inefficient at best. Benefits are decent. 401k match is 1% which sucks compared to industry standards. The match is not paid until the next year and is not guaranteed if you leave. Every day is a fire drill based on what the C Suite feels priority is. Constant stress. Employees don't get acknowledged for good work or project completion. Always onto the next task. Fear based leadership = micromanaging. Careful with this. Seems innocent at first but it's not worth being apart of. They push surveys and goals to increase survey scores. Maybe look at the real problems and address them rather than force high ratings. When people leave, might or might not get severance or pto time. Subjective. Depends if leaders like them or not.

employerResponses.response:
Thank you for sharing your experience at Logic20/20 – we value honest feedback from our community. We’re always working to improve employee experience through career opportunities, evolving benefits, and improved systems and look to our teams to guide where we focus investments (sorry about all the surveys, but we do hope our employees keep taking them). In 2024 we’re focused on: 
•	Changing benefits to provide better family medical coverage, parental leave, and 401(k) match.
•	Planning for and investing in infrastructure that will improve employee experience and help us scale
•	Employee programs like increased training and an audit of committees to make sure we’re serving our distributed teams. 

If you have additional feedback to share, we’d love to hear from you, anonymously or not.

reviews.pros: The worker-bee level positions are some of the smartest and nicest people to work with. Events are engaging, fun, collaborative. Good collab for remote work. Hubs in US are growing. Good values.

reviews.cons:
- The T-Mobile group I worked with had some really smart people but they had a hard time communicating. The code and documentation was very unorganized. As a result, onboarding to this project as a new member was rough.
- As for Logic 20/20, they didn't seem to care much on how well you performed on your project. When they started cutting employees it seemed like it was based on tenure rather than merit.

jobTitle.text: Software Development Engineer In Test (SDET) II

reviews.pros:
- Flexible hours
- Worked with some nice people
- Good pay
reviews.summary: It was an Alright Experience (T-Mobile group)

reviews.advice: Whatever actually happened was completely unprofessional, deceptive, and if you continue such practices you will gain that reputation.
reviews.cons:
After client project end, I was informed I would be placed on the bench to find a new placement. After less than a week, I was brought into a last minute meeting and informed I was being fired. For what? I had a completely positive performance review. Logic cited 'communication issues', in which the only relevant event had been a point in which I had actually ended up requesting a disability accommodation. Throughout the exit process they refused to provide any other examples of communication issues, or why they were not discussed in my performance review.

I don't know if they actually fired me over disability issues or just to keep from paying me on the bench and/or unemployment, but my recommendation to anyone and everyone is to stay far away. They will tell you they appreciate you until they yank the rug.
reviews.pros: Most of my time with Logic was spent with a client team, which was overall a positive team to be on

reviews.cons: No major cons - the company does have more manual processes than we'd like, but the bulk are on the roadmap to remedy.
reviews.pros:
*The Logic20/20 leadership team (at all levels) models our company values and prioritizes employee experience. There is also a significant focus on leadership development, career development, and strategic inititatives that are focused on infrastructure, including AI and automation.
*The people are phenomenal - intelligent, kind, and colloborative. 
*PTO is generous and people are encouraged to regularly schedule time off 
*Company continues to invest in healthcare benefits, 401(k) matching, and mental health benefits
*Great mix of in person and online culture events, including volunteer, learning, and social opportunities, 
*Engaged leadership team with actual open door policy (both in person and online)
*Interesting, high-impact projects at large accounts
reviews.summary: Focus on employee experience and strategic growth

reviews.advice: Hone in on specialty niches--either industry concentration or very specific capabilities that differentiate us from our competitors.
reviews.cons:
Turnover feels high, and it's always hard to see friends move onto other companies.  The good news is that people leave for varying reasons, but it's typically positive--going to work for a client, using a skill set developed at Logic to make big $ at Amazon, travel the world.  

Also, the 401k matching program is indisputably awful.

employerResponses.response: Thank you for your feedback. Logic20/20 aims to cultivate a workplace where support and growth for employees is a top priority and we are continually looking for more ways to build upon this. The launch of our career management program, our upcoming move to bigger office space, and a constant review of our benefits package are just some of the steps we are making to meet the professional needs of our employees.

reviews.pros: I've been with the firm for two years and experienced high-five worthy successes and a few disappointing lows on projects and internal activities.  What's unique at Logic is that the I have yet to feel like management is looking for opportunity to call me out on my mistakes.  Instead, the environment is intentionally set up to support you and help you grow.  If your client is flying off the handle, Logic will do its best to understand and empathize with the consultant as its first reaction.  Any "learning opportunities" would truly be just that and not punitive in nature.  If you're from a Big 4 or investment banking background, it's going to feel odd that management and your peers genuinely care about you and your well being.

reviews.advice: Foster a true consultant culture, not the superficial brainwashing and make-believe. Treat people with respect. Recognize your senior contributors, instead of alienating them. Give employees a true sense of ownership in the business success instead of communist style central planning squashing any individual drive toward excellence.
reviews.cons: Too many chiefs, too few warriors: Manager versus IC ratio = 40/60. Micro-management by incompetentn, non-caring managers who are driven by financial greed, not best interest of client. Frequently put consultants in cross fire for doing the right thing for client versus being blindly obedient toward ignorant management. Many pre-sales opportunities (referrals) fell through for lack of follow-through. Consultants get punished for doing the right thing for client. Management is more busy with their own self-importance. Employees are held accountable to retro-actively changing objectives at review time. Employees are not rewarded for doing great client work. Projects are grossly mis-managed, if managed at all. Even though called "consultants", work is actually hourly body-shop work, hourly rate is all that seems to matter.
reviews.pros: The majority of the individual contributors (field consultants) are a great bunch to work with. Super intelligent, motivated, social, helpful.
reviews.summary: Management is incompetent, disrespectful, unethical and greedy

reviews.cons:
Interview process can last several months to determine if you will be a good fit for the company and a fit for available/potential projects. They have plenty of articles as a fastest growing company or the best place to work for, but there is a high turnover. My time spent interviewing was not worth the outcome. 
Many moving parts, skills/practice mismatch. No visibility on project opportunities to apply - you are basically left with trusting management to find a fit for your "dream" project. Noone is perfect, right? - look into the risk of not having a project, or filling in for just an ad-hoc project. Overall, you might end up underutilizing your potential and skills, or lacking knowledge leverage. They do offer free courses for different certs but it's not the same as the real experience. 
Management invests heavily into marketing of its  "We" culture with lots of events and happy hours. It's all great but instead I'd rather have a better 401K match or unlimited free parking, especially with such a revenue growth rate!

employerResponses.response:
Thank you for your feedback. We’re glad that you were pleased with the work/life balance and our company culture. However, we are sorry that you had a poor experience during the interview process and felt a lack of visibility in project placement. We work hard to create an environment where our employees feel heard and supported, so we appreciate you sharing your thoughts.

We want to help all our employees navigate a career path that they find interesting, challenging, and satisfying. Our career management program allows employees to pair with a career manager, set goals, and create a path for how to reach them. Career managers advocate for their mentees when necessary, and we encourage our employees to meet regularly with these managers and our resourcing leads to make sure they are placed on projects that align with the goals they’ve set. 

We also always strive to improve and increase the benefits we provide. As we continue to grow, we conduct an annual survey to determine which current and potential benefits are most important to our employees, then implement them as we are able. Thank you again for sharing your comments.

reviews.pros: Company has a good footprint in Seattle, many happy hours and events, friendly people,  flexibility, opportunity to study for certifications, coffee and snacks.
reviews.summary: High turnover vs. Long interview process

reviews.advice: Be more clear about what you're hiring for. If you need software developers, fine. But if you need consultants that are just salesmen, hire for that.
reviews.cons:
The office culture was very old school (in my experience). You must dress better, speak better and smell better than the clients. Even if your client is wearing death metal t-shirts to work, you must be dressed in business, which in the developer world makes you look like an outcast. Instead of being part of the 'team' I was the weird one.

It practically took an act of congress to take time off. In my experience it took multiple approvals internally and then from the client. 

The mandatory consultant training is one of the most painful experiences of my career, and I've done a few of them with other companies. It seems to be more focused on dressing appropriately and finding more business than anything.  

It does amaze me that this place is able to get developers in Seattle. If you're just a salesman then you'll be in the right place. If you want to write awesome software and be treated like a grown up, find another place.
reviews.pros:
They have their foot in the door at some good companies which can lead to some good experiences if you put in the time.

Compensation was fine for the market.
reviews.summary: Worst consulting company I've ever worked for if you want to write awesome software

reviews.advice: Where/When possible, build in 2-3 days of official onboarding time at Logic20/20 before new hires are set to begin with a client.
reviews.cons: After a lengthy recruiting and onboarding process, I suddenly had a very compressed schedule to begin work both at Logic20/20 and with my client..  I essentially had to learn two jobs at once, feeling like I was in over my head.  That being said, I was able to "tread water" after two weeks.
reviews.pros: I first connected with a Logic20/20 recruiter in Aug '15 and finally joined the company in Mar '16.  The onboarding timeline - from initial meeting, to successive interviews, to job placement - took longer than I would have hoped, but my counterparts at Logic20/20 were very open and honest throughout the process.  I always knew what to expect, had scheduled times to check-in with my recruiter, and was given ample opportunity to meet with prospective clients.  It was worth the wait and I am very happy with my new company and my first client.  I feel that I was set up for success and intend to deliver accordingly.

reviews.advice: Continue to shape the company with strategic direction and focus. As expansion occurs, don't lose sight of the small company feel.
reviews.cons: Some resources are lacking in terms of standardized training or learning opportunities but individual requests are always taken into consideration by upper management. Also, internal communications needs to be improved to keep up with all of the professional and social activities going on.
reviews.pros:
Logic20/20 provides employees at every level of the organization with the opportunity to learn and grow in a fast-paced and professional environment. The company prides itself on hiring intelligent and hardworking individuals and offers a variety of career paths in management, business consulting, and technical consulting.  

In addition to working on interesting projects and with great clients, employees also benefit from monthly social events and close partnerships with local and global non-profit organizations. Logic20/20 believes in a strong company culture and continually provides consultants with the opportunity to provide candid feedback.

The company is led by a focused and caring senior leadership team that put consultant and client interests ahead of their own. Hardworking and dedicated employees are rewarded with a competitive benefits package and bonus structure.
reviews.summary: Great people, fun culture, growing company

reviews.advice: Keep staying in tune with the market and keep improving benefits.
reviews.cons:
* This really isn't that much of a con but, you need to be able to speak with leadership and all is good.  Need to be a strong individual as opportunities won't just come to you.  You need to be proactive to get the types of contracts/experiences you want.
* 401k isn't much.
* Yearly review process could be improved by not having an intermediary.  Leadership needs to speak directly to the leads & PMs to understand each employee's review, instead of getting it collated and presented to them (that being said, the reviews are fair and lead to good things for the coming year).
reviews.pros:
* Leadership works hard to make sure it is a great work environment
* They truly do their best to make sure the client is always happy
* They learn.  They will admit to not doing as well as they wanted and are not afraid of trying new things to consistently keep a great working environment while growing and adapting to the market.
reviews.summary: Leadership strives to make a great working environment and grow at the same time

reviews.advice: Keep moving forward and sending the elevator back down...
reviews.cons: Career management program could use more communication.  They’re shoring up gaps in the onboarding programs.  Their systems, while being upgraded, lack the sophisticated integration needed for a company of this size and growth curve.  Some of this is due to growing so quickly and just not having enough time/staff to tackle as they would like.
reviews.pros: Doors are open to new ideas, thoughts and suggestions.  Culturally open-minded.  Employee focused - they care about the individual.  Expertise from all levels of the organization.  Dedicated, thoughtful, brave, bold and confident.  There's a high degree of courage from the leadership; to not only constantly review their positions on major subjects within, but also in their willingness to take intelligent chances, whether in new business, client engagements, or employee programs.  They also have enough belief in their own values and ethos as a culture, that they are willing to turn down business they're unable to provide a high degree of quality control to.  Technically, they're changing the game in certain areas.   They've also hired new talent and their growth outside of the greater Seattle area is accelerating.

reviews.advice:
-Consider the questionable ethics of rich white guys exploiting minority-owned business status.
-Compare your attrition rate to other consulting companies and ask yourself what you're doing wrong, or just own up to being a staffing agency.
-Be a better place to work by offering enough PTO that a person can afford to, in the same year, go on vacation AND be able to not work if seriously ill.
reviews.cons:
-Run by a bunch of privileged white guys who are somehow managing to exploit minority-owned business incentives. Only one female in senior leadership. All senior leadership is white. Very much a good old boys club. A particularly obnoxious leader actually referred to my adult female colleague as "that girl," because despite her years of tenure, he couldn't recall her name.
-Unpleasant and uncomfortable physical work environments both at Logic and at Microsoft.
-Unreal attrition: 100-person company and at least 10 people left in my first month.
-You are only as good as your billable hours.
-Professional development opportunities are meaningless except to those with very new careers.

employerResponses.response:
Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts and concerns.

To address a number of them. Logic20/20 is a certified minority owned business and certified by three separate bodies: the federal government, the state, and the NMSDC. The process to be certified is lengthy and rigorous.  Logic20/20 is committed to being a diverse employer and, at the time of this response, 40% of the workforce are female (well above industry norms).  Of a nine person senior leadership team, two are female and two are East Indian. 

The work conditions are of great importance to us. We have been growing at a rapid pace which has, in turn, grown our consultant workforce and we are actively looking for the right space and location and hope to announce something in the coming months. 

Career progression: every employee has a manager and career counselor, with the goal of providing support and guidance to achieve success. We empower and encourage our employees to take advantage of internal and external trainings that provide value to their career growth. 

As with most local consulting models, there are a number of individual contributor roles for a variety of business reasons. Consistently, over many years, more than 70% of our projects are multi person teams with defined outcomes. Our clients range from multiple fortune 500 companies, recently funded start-ups, and state and local government.

Our retention rate appears consistent with industry norm. We reviewed our records and at no time, going back over the past 24 months, has there been attrition as described by the reviewer.

Please feel free to contact the HR team at HR@logic2020.com with any additional feedback as we always strive to find areas where we can improve.

reviews.pros:
This might be a good place to build your resume if you're inexperienced, and you end up on a good project (or projects), and you're willing to be deal with crappy benefits and PTO for a year or two.

Talented coworkers and dedicated administrative staff.
reviews.summary: Mostly a low-rent Microsoft staffing firm

reviews.cons: Salaries aren't quite as high as other similarly-sized consultancies, but in my opinion, I am compensated very fairly and the culture and career growth Logic offers is worth the tradeoff compared to what I could be making elsewhere. You will need to decide for yourself what matters most to you - for me, happiness > pay.
reviews.pros:
People and culture - you get out what you put in, but this company cares about its employees and their individual well-being, so protecting work-life balance is supported and encouraged. I got lots of mileage out of 1:1s and mentorships.

Career opportunities - Career management is employee-driven, as it should be, but in my experience Logic has been great about meeting me where I am and giving me opportunities to try new things aligned with my goals, often much sooner in my career than I would have gotten elsewhere. Approach it with patience and humility and you will be taken care of.
reviews.summary: Great place to accelerate your career

reviews.cons: same cons as any consulting firm, there may not be projects taht exactly fit your requirements.

reviews.cons: Most of the team is remote, though there are occasional meet-ups. Consulting takes strong communication and a working style that is not everyone's cup of tea.
reviews.pros: Logic is the most collaborative company I have worked for. Good, smart people working on the same team is what I love most about it. The work is interesting and usually has good growth opportunities.

reviews.cons: The commute to SODO gets old

reviews.advice:
Hire more diverse individuals for management roles. 

Ensure employees are being paid a livable wage. Improve the lack of sustainable (long term) contracts as it will improve the quality of the companies work and their employees quality of life. 

Get more parking. 

Put together a training for management regarding how to be effective leaders instead of fear mongers.
reviews.cons:
Cliquey, unrealistic expectations, lack of parking in a busy area. There are inconsistent work opportunities (contracts tend to end early which is stated as allowed in the employee contracts). 

Lots of favoritism for the privileged employees (example invites to executives homes etc).

Huge lack of diversity here as well. Management = mainly wealthy white men or women. One manager was extremely passive aggressive and irritable. I was not given clear info or guidance on issues but then would get written up for said issues I was unaware of.  I was bullied by this manager (called names like “idiot” and given eye rolls etc) as were numerous other individuals during company meetings. When this was raised with HR no changes or training occurred.

Lack of understanding for common life occurrences/issues is big here unless you’re in management. Execs + mgmt are unaware and insensitive regarding normal life problems.

Health insurance is subpar at best.

Managers are chosen based off of discriminatory practices, not based off who is best fit for the role.

Overall, unless you’re a wealthy and/or privileged individual you will not succeed here. You will be pushed out.

employerResponses.response:
We are very sorry to hear about your experience here at Logic20/20. We value all our current and former employees’ feedback. We would love to understand and learn more specifically around your experience with your management team and your HR experience. 

We strive to be a best place to work and do business with and we stand by our company values  of acting with integrity and fostering our culture of we.  Logic20/20 has always committed to being a company where all individuals can thrive.  Respect and inclusivity are fundamental in how we interact with our employees, clients, and community. 
This year, we are focused on rolling out management training programs that will help our management team be the best leaders in the industry. 

Thank you again for taking the time to provide your feedback and we are open to connecting with you.

reviews.cons: I don't think my perspective is so much 'biased', as it is 'experienced' in stating that growing pains are just sucky, no matter what company you work for. I've had the privilege to work at some very large companies (cough *fruit stands and shipping giants* cough), but also at the opposite end of the spectrum at startups. Either way you slice it growing pains are just that - painful. Logic seems to be experiencing that now; the change in processes, new leadership moves, adding and subtracting staff, etc. So if you're looking to that established, well-groomed, and perfectly segmented company...this probably isn't the best place for you.
reviews.pros:
From the moment I joined, I felt welcomed by my colleagues and leaders. The leadership team at Logic20/20 is not only knowledgeable and experienced, but also genuinely invested in the growth and well-being of their employees - something I will admit, not all employees here may get the opportunity to experience. I feel lucky to live in the Seattle area, where I can go into the office and see our leadership team in-person, whenever I want. It's allowed me several opportunities to casually chat with them, and you can see the genuine authenticity in "practicing what they preach" about our company values. 

There is also a strong emphasis on professional development and career autonomy here. I've benefited a lot from the learning opportunities I've had access to, but I'll be candid in stating "autonomy is not for the weak-minded." Having autonomy to learn and grow with how I see my career advancing means not always having a written path to follow from management. I have plenty of support and access to tools, sure, but it's on me to be motivated enough to use those things to advance my career. If you're a self-starter, you're going to do so SO well here.
